skill.name: jutsu-creator
skill.description: Create new jutsu/skills for SHINOBI WAY game. Use when user wants to add abilities, techniques, jutsu, or combat skills. Guides through all parameters and generates TypeScript code.
skill.summary: Create new jutsu/skills for SHINOBI WAY game. Use when user wants to add abilities, techniques, juts...
skill.author: CesarAugustusGroB

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only TypeScript templates and game design guidance. No executable code, network access, file system modification, or external dependencies detected.

content.value_statement: Creating balanced game skills requires understanding damage formulas, elemental interactions, and turn-based mechanics. This skill provides a step-by-step workflow to design and generate TypeScript skill definitions for SHINOBI WAY.
actual_capabilities: Guide users through jutsu creation workflow with 9 defined steps
Generate TypeScript skill code with proper interfaces and enums
Provide balance guidelines for damage tiers and cooldown standards
Define skill tiers from BASIC to KINJUTSU with appropriate costs
Create action types: MAIN, TOGGLE, SIDE, and PASSIVE skills
Add status effects like STUN, BUFF, BURN, and SHIELD to skills
limitations: Does not integrate with external APIs or databases
Does not modify project files automatically
Limited to SHINOBI WAY game skill format only
Requires user to manually add generated code to the project

use_cases.title: Create balanced combat skills
use_cases.description: Design new jutsu with proper damage scaling, elemental interactions, and status effects following established balance guidelines.

use_cases.title: Extend skill roster
use_cases.description: Add clan-specific abilities, forbidden techniques, or custom tiers to expand the game's skill library.

use_cases.title: Prototype skill variations
use_cases.description: Quickly generate skill variations to test damage numbers, cooldowns, and resource costs before final implementation.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Fire Jutsu
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a BASIC tier fire jutsu called Fireball with medium chakra cost and a burn effect on hit.

prompt_templates.title: Forbidden Technique
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a FORBIDDEN tier clan-exclusive skill with TRUE damage type and self-stun effect.

prompt_templates.title: Toggle Stance
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a TOGGLE skill that increases multiple stats with an upkeep cost per turn.

prompt_templates.title: Passive Bonus
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a PASSIVE skill that provides passive regeneration and stat bonuses while equipped.

output_examples.input: Create a basic lightning jutsu with paralysis effect

best_practices: Start with BASIC tier skills before designing higher tiers for better balance
Follow the damage multiplier guidelines based on skill tier and resource cost
Include intelligence requirements to gate powerful skills appropriately
Use elemental interactions to create synergy between different jutsu types
anti_patterns: Creating skills with damage multipliers that exceed tier guidelines
Adding TOGGLE skills without meaningful upkeep costs
Making SIDE skills that deal significant direct damage
Skipping clan requirements for clan-specific techniques

faq.question: What tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude Code for local development. It generates TypeScript code ready for integration.

faq.question: What skill tiers are available?
faq.answer: BASIC, ADVANCED, HIDDEN, FORBIDDEN, and KINJUTSU. Each has specific damage and cost guidelines.

faq.question: Can I create clan-specific skills?
faq.answer: Yes. Add a clan requirement to restrict skills to specific clans like UCHIHA or HYUGA.

faq.question: Is the data safe?
faq.answer: This skill is read-only. It generates code templates but does not access or modify project files.

faq.question: Why is my skill unbalanced?
faq.answer: Check damage multipliers against tier guidelines. High chakra costs should match higher multipliers.

faq.question: How is this different from combat systems?
faq.answer: This skill creates the skill DATA. Combat systems handle turn execution. Use combat-system-creator for battle mechanics.
